comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Possibly General Frederick Appleton Smith, who retired on May 15, 1913, according to his obituary in the NYT of Feb 5, 1922 query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9B06E2D71130EE3AB... If so, a summary of his military career is in the NYT of March 12, 1911 UNCLE SAM'S GENERALS ON THE MEXICAN FRONTIER query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9D04E4D71331E233A... And, according to NYT of January 28, 1915, he married at age 64, a widow, Mrs. Hevenor, the former Emma Mandeville. query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9E0DE4DA1538E633A...

comment.author: 35014516@N03
comment._content: It does seem likely this is the same person.  We'll add him as "possibly" the same person next time we update the record.
